thesis.description: Research in sensory localization has largely ignored the problem of the cerebral mechanisms involved in temperature discrimination. One of the main reasons for this has been the difficulty in constructing a suitable apparatus with which to measure the discrimination of temperature gradients in infrahuman mammals.
thesis.creator: Downer, John. L.
thesis.subject: Psychology.
thesis.title: The role of cerebral cortex in temperature discrimination.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: “Man’s desire to live, to be in the world, is inseparable from his desire to live well… not being, but well-being is the fundamental necessity of man” These are the words of a contemporary philosopher, Jose Ortega y Gasset. It seems fitting to start out a discussion of the philosophy behind any investigation in the words of a philosopher, especially when his words so adequately fit into the general field under scrutiny; in this case mental hygiene.
thesis.creator: Deyoung, Anne. M.
thesis.subject: Social Work.
thesis.title: How schools use a mental hygiene clinic.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The mast cell is one of the few outposts of the body to which, as yet, no definite function has been attributed. These cells, with their numerous coarse basophilic metachromatic granules, are classified into two groups, firstly, the blood mast cells, or mast leucocytes, or basophils, and secondly, the tissue or histogenous mast cells. Modern authorities agree that the only common feature possessed by these two groups, aside from their name, is the basic metachromatic staining reaction of their granules.
thesis.creator: Devitt, James. E.
thesis.subject: Experimental Surgery.
thesis.title: A study of the tissue mast cell
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: To extend to tissue suspensions the work of Krebs (1950) on the design of a medium which will allow maximum respiration of tissue slices. Krebs found that with various members of the tricarboxylic acid cycle added to the medium, the oxygen uptake of sliced tissues was greatly increased (see literature review section Ib). lt was considered of interest to investigate the effect of these substrates on suspensions since these are frequently used rather than slices.
thesis.creator: Desbarats, Marie-Louise.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: Studies on brain tissue metabolism: effects of the composition medium, pentobarbital, and age.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Holmes once wrote that a page of history is worth a volume of logic. This is especially true in ascertaining the standards of conduct civilized nations observe in waging war. There is no superior law in the Austinian sense which can impose and enforce a mandatory group of rules or ethics on belligerents. It is each nation's own set of humanitarian values conbined w th the force of w0rld opinion which produces a level of decency in the prosecution of war.
thesis.creator: DeSaussure, Hamilton.
thesis.subject: Law.
thesis.title: International law and aerial warcraft.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The subject matter of the thesis is concerned with the design and construction of a double pulse generator and an associated calibrating pulse marker generator. The double pulse generator is to be used for calibrating the resolving times of three specific paralysis circuits to be used by Professcr C. H. Westc ott in counting experiments. It has been buil t to perform this function for the range from about two microseconds to about fifteen milliseconds to an accuracy of about one percent.
thesis.creator: Densmore, Arthur. A.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: The design and construction of a double pulse generator.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Examination of radar records shows that snow trails frequently occur around the tops of showers. Evidence has been sought that showers can be initiated by snow trails. Cumulus clouds with tops above the freezing level often fail to precipitate. Theoretical studies show that snow trails could act as seeding agents for cumulus clouds, entrainment providing the mechanism whereby snow enters a cloud. Certain observed radar patterns suggest strongly that showers were produced in this manner. As a check, polar diagrams can be used to organize observations made on different bearings. Those constructed show showers occurring in regions of snow trails more frequently than elsewhere. This is further evidence that snow can act as a seeding agent in cumulus clouds.
thesis.creator: Dennis, Arnett. S.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: Interactions between continuous and showery precipitation.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Studies on the phenomenon of mechanization have demonstrated that under certain conditions, excessive effort rather than economy of effort is often characteristic of the organism’s adjustment to even relatively simple situations. For example, a child must take a detour for several weeks because of road repairs between his house and the nearby school. Will he continue to take the longer route after the road has been cleared, and if so, for how long?
thesis.creator: Deitcher, Samuel.
thesis.subject: Psychology.
thesis.title: The effect of physical effort on mechanization.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The fundamental importance of desoxyribonuoleic acid (DNA) in cytophysiology is readily understood when it ia realized that this substanoe is a major constituent of chromosomes. Its location in these bodies corresponds to the loci of the genes, the carriers ot the hereditary characters (15,76,97,104,105).
thesis.creator: Daoust, Roger. J.
thesis.subject: Anatomy.
thesis.title: The fate of nucleic acids in resting and dividing cells.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: In every generation since the Renaissance there have been worthy disciples of those men who rediscovered the ancient world of Greece and Rome, with its intellectual freedom and courage and warm love of life, and who prized the Greek and Latin classics for their humanizing influence even more than for their intrinsic beauty. Petrarch and his followers found exemplified in the bodies of the statutes and the minds of the writers of the Graeco-Roman world a new ideal of individual life lived at its greatest intensity.
thesis.creator: Dale, Marjorie.
thesis.subject: English.
thesis.title: Osler as a humanist.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A new isotope Pr137 has been discovered, its half-life measured as 1.5 ± 0.1 hours, and its positron end point energy as 1.7 ± 0.1 Mev. For Pr138 (2.0 hours) a previous tentative mass assignment has been confirmed, and two conversion electrons with energies of 262± 5 Kev. and 299 ± 5 Kev. have been found associated with its decay. These electrons appear to be K and L conversions from a 300 Kev. transition in Ce138.
thesis.creator: Dahlstrom, C. E.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: Neutron deficient isotopes of praseodymium.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A greater understanding of the growth and development of children has resulted from recent studies undertaken by experts in the field of child care. The normal pattern of growth and development, the deviations from the normal, and the environmental influences upon growth have been discussed by Gesell and Amatruda. The authors have formulated the concept of developmental diagnosis which refers to the necessity for diagnosing deviant development, in order to learn what can be expected of the child's later development.
thesis.creator: Cupchik, Zelda.
thesis.subject: Social Work.
thesis.title: A study of growth of intellectually retarded children.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A paraboloidal optical system is proposed for antenna measurements at microwave frequencies; the precision of measurement would be limited primarily by diffraction due to the finite dimensions of the exit pupil of the device. Multiple scatterine between the feed and the antenna under examination would be minimized by the use of a reflector with a long focal length.
thesis.creator: Crysdale, John. H.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: An optical system for antenna measurements at microwave frequencies.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Previous to World War II, little attention has been accorded to the possible use of vegetable oils in the commercial preparation of shortenings. This was largely due to the fact that most oils of vegetable origin possess relatively strong and objectionable odors which must be eliminated by extensive processing before they are acceptable to and nutritionally sound for the use of the consumer population.
thesis.creator: Crawford, Donna. J.
thesis.subject: Agriculture
thesis.title: Studies on the nutritive value of some thermally polymerized edible oils subjected to steam distillation and subsequent urea fractionation.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A pattern of alteration has been worked out; and it is hoped that these changes in bulk composition of the wall rock caused by the metasomatic effect of mineralizing fluids can be related to possible mineralogical changes. Care has been taken to describe the local metasomatic changes brought about by the intrusion of igneous rocktypes; as these changes May be confused with those affected by the mineralizing fluids.
thesis.creator: Cornwall, Frederick. W.
thesis.subject: Geochemistry.
thesis.title: The distribution of Na, K, Ca, Mg, Fe in metasomatic zones bordering diorite intrusives, and zones of sulphide mineralization; using a revised analytical technique in flame spectrophotometry.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The Johan Beetz Area is situated on the north shore of the Gulf of St. Lawrence and is bounded by latitudes 50°15'N and 50°30'N, and by longtitudes 62°3O'W and 63°00'W. It measures about 22 miles east-west and 17 miles north-south and is approximately 350 square miles in area. Johan Beetz, after which this area has been named, is a small settlement on the shore about midway between the east and west boundaries of the area.
thesis.creator: Cooper, Gerald. E.
thesis.subject: Geology.
thesis.title: Geology of the Johan Beetz area Saguenay county.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: As early as 1848, Frankland and Kolbe (26) observed the reaction of propionitrile with metallic sodium in the absence of a solvent. The reaction products were sodium cyanide, ethane, and an organic base which they named cyanoethene (I). The structure of (I) was elucidated by Ernst von Meyer (41) in 1889, and was shown to be a derivative of aminopyrimidine. In 1869, A.G. Bayer (6,7) investigated the behavior of acetonitrile toward metallic sodium under similar conditions.
thesis.creator: Conn, J. J.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: The reactions and isomerism of β-aminocrotononitrile and the reaction of aromatic grignard reagents with β-aminocrotononitrile.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Since the subject matter which comes before the modern legislators is so intricate and diverse, lawmaking has tended to shift upward into the executive branch thus relegating the legislature to the function of deliberation. Even though the Cabinet in conjunction with the civil service formulates the legislative proposals and force them through Parliament, the power concentrated in the executive is not so great as many students might believe. For, the crystallization and the actual initiation of policy have shifted downward into the various social and economic groups within the community.
thesis.creator: Collins, F. L.
thesis.subject: Canadian National Railways.
thesis.title: The Impact of the Railway Brotherhoods on the Canadian National Railways
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The properties of concrete are being investigated for the last thirty years. Aside from the action of direct load, deformations are produced in concrete by changes in temperature and in moisture content. Concrete, like steel and other structural materials, expands when heated, and contracts when cooled. In general, the coefficient of thermal expansion for concrete is considered to be not much different from that of carbon steel which is 6.5 x 10 -6 per degree F. Therefore, these two materials are assumed to contract or expand together in reinforced concrete structures. [...]
thesis.creator: Chow, David Y.F.
thesis.subject: Engineering.
thesis.title: Thermal Contraction and Moisture Creep in Concrete.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The speckled trout, Salvelinus fontinalis (Mitchill), is highly valued in the Province of Quebec as a game fish. However, little is known regarding the distribution and importance of the helminth parasites of this fish in Quebec, or the biology, the systematic status and morphology of some of the species involved. [...]
thesis.creator: Choquette, Laurent P.E.
thesis.subject: Biology.
thesis.title: Studies on Some Internal Helminths Parasitic in the Trout Salvelinus Fontinalis (Mitchill) in Quebec.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A number of bacteria have been isolated by the soil perfusion method of Lees and Quastel (1946) which actively metabolize cholic acid (Quastel, Scholefield and Stevenson, 1952); during the course of experiments wlth these organisms, it was found that they induced a significantly consistent lymphocytopenia upon injection into rabbits (Stevenson and DeVries, 1952). [...]
thesis.creator: Charles, C. Margaret.
thesis.subject: Bacteriology.
thesis.title: a Lymphocytopenic factor Produced by Soil Bacteria.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Fatty infiltration of the liver, though a common pathological finding associated with many diseases and frequently observed in routine autopsies, remains largely an enigma to the clinician and the biochemist. The importance of this lesion is recognized, for fatty infiltration has been shown to result in an impairment of hepatic function (54,188) and, if severe, to terminate in cirrhosis (39,41,46,47). Recent reports in the literature on the use of adrenocorticotropic hormone and cortisone for the treatment of acute and chronic liver disease (26,29,82,44) are somewhat conflicting. [...]
thesis.creator: Chappel, Clifford Ian.
thesis.subject: Biology.
thesis.title: the Influence of Hormones on Experimental Hepatic Lesions.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Measurements of input impedance of cylindrical antennas have been made with a variation of antenna length, diameter and centre spacing. The results are shown in a series of graphs. The variation of resistance and reactance is shown to be in the same direction as contained in the literature.
thesis.creator: Carruthers, F.R.
thesis.subject: Engineering.
thesis.title: the Input Impedance of a Half-Wave Dipole.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Gaspé peninsula forms a tongue of land which extends into the Gulf of St. Lawrence, in the eastern part of the Province of Quebec. From its western boundary, the valley of the Matapedia river, to its eastern one, the Bay of Gaspé, the peninsula has a length of approximately 150 miles and a width, between the St. Lawrence estuary and the Bay of Chaleurs, of between 70 and 90 miles.
thesis.creator: Carbonneau, C.
thesis.subject: Geology.
thesis.title: Geology of the Big Berry Mountains Map-Area Gaspe Peninsula, Quebec.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The individuality of animal species as regards responsiveness to hormonal treatment is a well recognized fact in endocrinology. Probably the best example has been furnished by pituitary growth hormone, due perhaps to its multiple metabolic effects and complex mechanism of action. In the case of this hormone, man illustrates perfectly the species idiosyncrasy. The promising therapeutic values expected from experimental work in animals have not been obtained in human subjects.
thesis.creator: Carballeira, Andres M.
thesis.subject: Biology.
thesis.title: Some Metabolic Effects of Pituitary Growth Hormone in Human Subjects.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.
